titleInfo.title: Unveiling the Information State with a Bayesian Model of the Listener

name.namePart: Los Angelouge – 15th Annual Workshop on the Semantics and Pragmatics of Dialogue

mods.abstract: Attentive speaker agents – artificial conversational agents that can attend to and adapt to listener feedback – need to attribute a mental ‘listener state’ to the user and keep track of the grounding status of their own utterances. We propose a joint model of listener state and information state, represented as a dynamic Bayesian network, that can capture the influences between dialogue context, user feedback, the mental listener state and the information state, providing an estimation of grounding.
